intro: Cyrtandra × obliqua, commonly known as the oblique cyrtandra, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to Hawaii and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Cyrtandra × obliqua thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas and rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
